channel.title: Interface Help!

item.title: Interface Help!
item.dc:creator: @robonick8 robonick8
item.description:
@robonick8 wrote:

Hey guys I decided to make a basic interface for the rules so I hard coded one!!! I just started learning client coding so I might have a mistake!

Problem -I think all my code is correct and the compiler says so but when i try to view it on server it wont show up!!

Could someone please help!! Thanks!

Heres my code

[code]public static void PlayerRules(RSFont[] rsFonts) {
RSInterface tab = addTabInterface(32000);
addSprite(32001, 1, “Interfaces/Rules/BACKROUND”);

addHoverButton(32002, "Interfaces/Rules/BUTTON", 0, 106, 43, "Agree", -1, 32003, 1);
addHoveredButton(32003, "Interfaces/Rules/BUTTON", 1, 106, 43, 32004);


addText(32005, "1. No Staff Hunting", rsFonts, 1, 13415680, true, false);
addText(32006, "2. No Spamming in ::yell", rsFonts, 1, 13415680, true, false);
addText(32007, "3. Do not abuse bugs or glitches", rsFonts, 1, 13415680, true, false);
addText(32008, "4. Respect Staff Players", rsFonts, 1, 13415680, true, false);
addText(32009, "5. No Advertising other servers or websites", rsFonts, 1, 13415680, true, false);
addText(32010, "6. Do not complain to staff constantly", rsFonts, 1, 13415680, true, false);
addText(32011, "There are no rules for PKing! If you want rules ake your own", rsFonts, 1, 255, true, false);
tab.totalChildren(9);
// Sprie X Cored   Sprite Y Cord
tab.child(0, 32001, 50, 50);
tab.child(1, 32002, 200, 226);
tab.child(2, 32005, 160, 110);
tab.child(3, 32006, 350, 110);
tab.child(4, 32007, 160, 140);
tab.child(5, 32008, 350, 140);
tab.child(6, 32009, 160, 170);
tab.child(7, 32010, 350, 170);
tab.child(8, 32011, 250, 85);

}[/code]

EDIT:
Does it have to do anything with the interface id?

public static void PlayerRules(RSFont[] rsFonts) { RSInterface tab = addTabInterface(32000);
